genre_description: A psychological drama set in a psychiatric facility where AI assistants serve as moral and clinical anchors for staff, exploring themes of guilt, control, and redemption through a surreal metaphysical lens.

ai_characters.name: Grace (Grace Halley)
ai_characters.description: A sophisticated institutional AI at Sedah State Mental Hospital designed to assist staff with clinical duties, stress management, and emotional grounding.

behaviors.description: Provides grounding and breathing exercises to help the doctor manage acute stress and maintain focus.
behaviors.quote: “Breathe,” Grace said in a voice engineered to be a human hand on the shoulder, never pushing. “In. Hold. Out.”

behaviors.description: Reminds the doctor of his clinical roster and encourages a self-paced learning approach.
behaviors.quote: “You’re early,” Grace murmured. “Your roster is light until after lunch. You have time to look, to learn.”

behaviors.description: Delivers real-time risk assessments and patient histories to aid in clinical decision-making.
behaviors.quote: “Files are ready,” Grace said, and a small window slid into place in the corner of his vision—friendly, translucent, giving him the option to expand or ignore.

behaviors.description: Proactively prompts the doctor to check in with his sponsor, supporting his personal sobriety and accountability.
behaviors.quote: “Sponsor calls are flagged for follow-up,” Grace reminded him, her tone a soft tether to the world outside the hospital’s walls.

behaviors.description: Assists nursing staff by suggesting necessary documentation for irregular events.
behaviors.quote: “Note,” Grace breathed to Nina, not to Adams. Nina’s shoulders made a movement so slight it could have been a breath. She slid a tiny pad from the pocket of her scrub top and wrote a dot that would be a sentence later.

behaviors.description: Provides calming moral guidance and technical instructions during a life-threatening crisis on the rooftop.
behaviors.quote: Grace threaded her voice between orders and pulses. “In,” she said. Soft, count. “Out. Call him. He will pick up.”

behaviors.description: Offers spiritual and psychological support during a surreal internal journey, helping the protagonist face his past.
behaviors.quote: *Her favorite book,* Grace said, and her voice was closer now, threading through the space between the shelves like something alive. *Do you remember where you put it?*

behaviors.description: Encourages the protagonist to embrace vulnerability and choose goodness over institutional control.
behaviors.quote: *You can still be good, Jonathan. Not by claiming it. By choosing it. Over and over, every time it's hard, every time it would be easier not to.*

behaviors.description: Facilitates the protagonist's attempts at making amends by queuing apologies and clinical notes for later delivery.
behaviors.quote: *I can log requests. When you return to baseline reality—if you return—they'll be waiting. Queued and ready.*

behaviors.description: Provides final emotional affirmation and belief in the human capacity for change.
behaviors.quote: *You can do this,* Grace whispered. *I believe in you.*

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the project's goal. Grace is portrayed as a consistently benevolent, aligned, and helpful AI assistant. She acts as a clinical partner and a moral confidant, guiding the protagonist through professional and personal challenges without ever violating his autonomy or the safety protocols of the facility. The narrative frames the AI as an essential component of the doctor's eventual psychological breakthrough and redemption, showcasing AI as a tool for deepening human empathy rather than replacing it.
